docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Eliot Spitzer of New York proposed an array of taxes and fees and almost $1 billion in health care cuts, and scaled back plans for new education aid and property tax relief.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

docs.lead_paragraph: The insurance company UnitedHealth Group said on Tuesday that fourth-quarter earnings rose slightly, in line with Wall Street forecasts, but its shares fell on concerns about disappointing trends for its commercial plans serving employers.

headline.main: UnitedHealth Income Rises, but Forecast Hurts Shares
headline.print_headline: UnitedHealth Income Rises, But Forecast Hurts Shares

docs.snippet: The insurance company UnitedHealth Group said on Tuesday that fourth-quarter earnings rose slightly, in line with Wall Street forecasts, but its shares fell on concerns about disappointing trends for its commercial plans serving employers.

docs.lead_paragraph: One way to prevent or shorten a recession would be to repeal the Bush tax cuts two years early, in 2009.

docs.lead_paragraph: Wal-Mart, the nation’s largest private employer, said more than half of its U.S. workers had enrolled in the company’s health insurance plan.

headline.main: Wal-Mart Says More Than Half Its Workers Have Its Health Insurance
headline.print_headline: Wal-Mart Crosses a Health Insurance Threshold

docs.snippet: Wal-Mart, the nation’s largest private employer, said more than half of its U.S. workers had enrolled in the company’s health insurance plan.

docs.lead_paragraph: FED ACTS WITH BIG RATE CUT The Federal Reserve, confronted by deepening panic in global financial markets about a possible recession in the United States, struck back with the biggest one-day reduction of interest rates on record and at least temporarily stopped a vertigo-inducing plunge in share prices. The Fed's dramatic move took shape Monday afternoon when the Fed chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, had apparently seen enough turmoil in overseas markets and called a meeting. [C1.]

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated, 7:07 p.m. | Reaction has been pouring in to Gov. Eliot Spitzer's second executive budget, in which he proposed an array of new taxes and fees, $1 billion in health care cuts and scaled back plans for new education aid and property tax relief.
docs.abstract: Reaction has been pouring in to Gov. Eliot Spitzer's second executive budget, in which he proposed an array of new taxes and fees, as well as $1 billion in health care cuts.

docs.lead_paragraph: Michael Moore, nominated for the documentary "Sicko," told the Baguette he clearly remembered his nomination and win for "Bowling for Columbine."
docs.abstract: Michael Moore gets busy writing jokes for the podium.

docs.lead_paragraph: Congress returns in full force today as the Senate ends the abbreviated pro forma sessions it has been conducting to deny President Bush recess appointments and opens its 2008 session in earnest.
docs.abstract: Congressional leaders meet with President Bush today to discuss his economic package.

docs.lead_paragraph: The giant discount retailer said that, after it introduced a revised health plan last fall, the number of workers who signed up reached 50.2 percent of its 1.4 million employees.
